question: Which sentence uses pronouns in the proper case?

answer_options.A: Him and I will finish the poster tomorrow.
answer_options.B: He and I will finish the poster tomorrow.
answer_options.C: He and me will finish the poster tomorrow.
answer_options.D: Him and me will finish the poster tomorrow.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because 'He' and 'I' are both subjective case pronouns functioning as the compound subject of the sentence. When pronouns serve as subjects, they must be in the subjective case.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence uses pronouns in the proper case?

answer_options.A: Him and me finished the project yesterday.
answer_options.B: The teacher gave the awards to her and I.
answer_options.C: His leaving early surprised everyone in the class.
answer_options.D: The coach congratulated he on his excellent performance.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because 'His' is the possessive pronoun that properly modifies the gerund 'leaving.' When a pronoun comes before a gerund (a verb form ending in -ing that functions as a noun), the pronoun must be in the possessive case.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence uses pronouns in the proper case?

answer_options.A: Him and me went to the movies yesterday.
answer_options.B: The coach praised he for his excellent performance.
answer_options.C: She lent her book to him for the weekend.
answer_options.D: Them and us finished the project on time.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because 'She' is in the subjective case as the subject of the sentence, 'her' is in the possessive case correctly modifying 'book,' and 'him' is in the objective case as the object of the preposition 'to.' All three pronouns are used in their proper cases.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence correctly uses an intensive pronoun?

answer_options.A: The author herself read the book aloud.
answer_options.B: The author read the book to myself.
answer_options.C: The author read the book by hisself.
answer_options.D: The author read the book to herself.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because "herself" is an intensive pronoun that emphasizes the noun "author." Intensive pronouns are used to emphasize or intensify a noun or pronoun and can be removed from the sentence without changing its core meaning.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence correctly uses an intensive pronoun to emphasize a noun?

answer_options.A: The author herself signed copies of her new book at the store.
answer_options.B: The players congratulated themselves after winning the championship.
answer_options.C: Jennifer and myself completed the project on time.
answer_options.D: He hurt himself while playing basketball last weekend.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because 'herself' is an intensive pronoun that emphasizes the noun 'author.' The sentence would still be complete and grammatically correct without 'herself' ('The author signed copies...'), which is the defining characteristic of intensive pronouns. In contrast, the pronouns in options B and D are reflexive—they are essential to the sentence meaning and cannot be removed. Option C incorrectly uses 'myself' as part of a compound subject, which is a grammatical error; the correct pronoun would be 'I.'
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence correctly uses an intensive pronoun to emphasize a noun or pronoun?

answer_options.A: The president himself signed the treaty.
answer_options.B: The president taught himself to speak French.
answer_options.C: Himself signed the treaty yesterday.
answer_options.D: The president bought a gift for himself.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because 'himself' is used as an intensive pronoun to emphasize the noun 'the president.' An intensive pronoun emphasizes a noun or pronoun already mentioned in the sentence and can be removed without changing the sentence's core meaning. In this sentence, 'himself' emphasizes that the president personally signed the treaty, and the sentence would still be grammatically complete as 'The president signed the treaty.'
subject: ELA

question: Read the sentence: "I always bring my own lunch to school because you can never be sure what the cafeteria will serve." Which choice corrects the inappropriate shift in pronoun person?

answer_options.A: I always bring my own lunch to school because I can never be sure what the cafeteria will serve.
answer_options.B: I always bring my own lunch to school because they can never be sure what the cafeteria will serve.
answer_options.C: You always bring your own lunch to school because you can never be sure what the cafeteria will serve.
answer_options.D: We always bring our own lunch to school because you can never be sure what the cafeteria will serve.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it maintains consistent first-person pronouns throughout the sentence. The original sentence inappropriately shifts from 'I' (first person) to 'you' (second person). The correct revision changes 'you' to 'I' so the sentence keeps the same point of view from start to finish.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best demonstrates the skill described in L.6.1.C at hard difficulty?

answer_options.A: The correct choice that matches the standard.
answer_options.B: An incorrect distractor.
answer_options.C: Another incorrect distractor.
answer_options.D: Another incorrect distractor.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it matches the skill described in the standard.
subject: ELA

question:
Which revision corrects the inappropriate shift in pronoun person?

"If a student wants to succeed, you must study hard."

answer_options.A: If a student wants to succeed, they must study hard.
answer_options.B: If a student wants to succeed, he or she must study hard.
answer_options.C: If a student wants to succeed, we must study hard.
answer_options.D: If a student wants to succeed, someone must study hard.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it maintains consistent third person reference throughout the sentence. The original sentence inappropriately shifts from third person ('a student') to second person ('you'). The revision uses 'he or she,' which correctly maintains third person to match the singular antecedent 'a student.'
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence contains a vague pronoun with an unclear antecedent?

answer_options.A: Sarah gave her brother a book for his birthday.
answer_options.B: When Jason called Marcus, he answered the phone.
answer_options.C: The teacher told the students to open their books.
answer_options.D: My sister and I walked to the store together.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the pronoun 'he' has an unclear antecedent—it could refer to either Jason or Marcus, making it ambiguous who answered the phone. This is an example of a vague pronoun, where the reader cannot determine which noun the pronoun refers to.
subject: ELA

question:
Which revision best clarifies the vague pronoun in the sentence below?

"The coach benched the player after he missed several practices, which disappointed the team."

answer_options.A: The coach benched the player after the player missed several practices, which disappointed the team.
answer_options.B: The coach benched the player after the coach missed several practices, which disappointed the team.
answer_options.C: The coach benched the player after he repeatedly missed several practices, which disappointed the team.
answer_options.D: The coach benched the player after missing several practices, which disappointed the team.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because the vague pronoun 'he' could refer to either the coach or the player. Replacing 'he' with 'the player' clarifies that it was the player who missed practices, which is the logical interpretation since a coach would not bench a player for the coach's own absence.
subject: ELA

question:
The cat escaped from the dog. Which revision best clarifies the ambiguous pronoun in the following sentence?

When the dog chased the cat, it ran up a tree.

answer_options.A: When the dog chased the cat, the dog ran up a tree.
answer_options.B: When the dog chased the cat, the cat ran up a tree.
answer_options.C: When the dog chased the cat, it climbed up a tree.
answer_options.D: When the dog chased the cat, they ran up a tree.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it replaces the vague pronoun 'it' with the specific noun 'the cat,' clearly identifying which animal ran up the tree. The context sentence states that the cat escaped from the dog, so the cat must be the one that ran up the tree to safety.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence uses standard English grammar?

answer_options.A: Me and my brother played basketball yesterday.
answer_options.B: My brother and I played basketball yesterday.
answer_options.C: My brother and me played basketball yesterday.
answer_options.D: Me played basketball with my brother yesterday.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because 'My brother and I played basketball yesterday' follows standard English grammar rules. In standard English, when the pronoun referring to oneself is part of the subject, the pronoun 'I' should be used, not 'me.' The other options use 'me' as part of the subject, which is a variation from standard English.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the following excerpt from a student's oral presentation transcript:

'I done finished my project yesterday, and it turned out real good. My partner and me worked on it for three weeks.'

Which choice best identifies the variations from standard English and describes an effective strategy for revising the language to follow standard conventions?

answer_options.A: The excerpt uses non-standard past tense forms and pronoun case; revise by changing 'done finished' to 'finished,' 'real good' to 'really well,' and 'My partner and me' to 'My partner and I' to align with standard English grammar.
answer_options.B: The excerpt uses overly casual vocabulary; revise by replacing 'project' with 'assignment' and 'worked' with 'collaborated' to create more formal language.
answer_options.C: The excerpt contains sentence fragments; revise by combining the two sentences into one longer sentence to improve flow.
answer_options.D: The excerpt uses incorrect verb tenses throughout; revise by changing all past tense verbs to present tense to describe ongoing work.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because the excerpt contains three variations from standard English: 'done finished' uses a non-standard double-marked past tense form (standard English uses 'finished'), 'real good' uses an adjective form as an adverb modifier (standard English uses 'really well'), and 'My partner and me' uses an object pronoun in subject position (standard English uses 'My partner and I'). The strategy of revising these specific forms aligns the language with standard English conventions.
subject: ELA

question: A student wrote the following sentence: "Me and my brother walked to the park." Which choice shows the sentence revised to follow standard English conventions?

answer_options.A: Me and my brother walked to the park.
answer_options.B: My brother and me walked to the park.
answer_options.C: My brother and I walked to the park.
answer_options.D: Me and my brother was walking to the park.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because the pronoun 'I' is the appropriate subject pronoun to use when the pronoun functions as part of the sentence's subject. In standard English, 'me' is an object pronoun and should not be used as a subject. Additionally, conventional style places the other person before oneself in compound subjects.
subject: ELA

question:
Which choice correctly punctuates the sentence?

Mrs. Chen our new math teacher gave us homework on the first day.

answer_options.A: Mrs. Chen our new math teacher gave us homework on the first day.
answer_options.B: Mrs. Chen, our new math teacher, gave us homework on the first day.
answer_options.C: Mrs. Chen our new math teacher, gave us homework on the first day.
answer_options.D: Mrs. Chen, our new math teacher gave us homework on the first day.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the phrase 'our new math teacher' is a nonrestrictive appositive that provides additional, nonessential information about Mrs. Chen. Nonrestrictive elements must be set off by punctuation on both sides, so commas are placed before and after the phrase.
subject: ELA

question:
Which choice correctly punctuates the nonrestrictive element in the sentence below?

The professor's groundbreaking research which was funded by a federal grant changed how scientists understand climate patterns.

answer_options.A: The professor's groundbreaking research which was funded by a federal grant, changed how scientists understand climate patterns.
answer_options.B: The professor's groundbreaking research, which was funded by a federal grant, changed how scientists understand climate patterns.
answer_options.C: The professor's groundbreaking research, which was funded by a federal grant changed how scientists understand climate patterns.
answer_options.D: The professor's groundbreaking research which was, funded by a federal grant, changed how scientists understand climate patterns.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the clause 'which was funded by a federal grant' is a nonrestrictive element that provides additional, nonessential information about the professor's research. Nonrestrictive elements must be set off by punctuation on both sides, and commas correctly surround the entire clause, separating it from the main sentence structure.
subject: ELA

question:
Which choice correctly punctuates the nonrestrictive element in the sentence below?

"Mount Everest the highest mountain in the world is located in the Himalayas."

answer_options.A: Mount Everest, the highest mountain in the world, is located in the Himalayas.
answer_options.B: Mount Everest the highest mountain in the world, is located in the Himalayas.
answer_options.C: Mount Everest, the highest mountain in the world is located in the Himalayas.
answer_options.D: Mount Everest the highest, mountain in the world is located in the Himalayas.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because the phrase "the highest mountain in the world" is a nonrestrictive appositive that renames Mount Everest. Nonrestrictive elements must be set off by punctuation on both sides, and this option correctly places commas before and after the appositive phrase.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice is spelled correctly?

answer_options.A: beleive
answer_options.B: freind
answer_options.C: believe
answer_options.D: recieve

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because 'believe' is the standard spelling of the word meaning 'to accept something as true.' The 'i' comes before 'e' in this word.
subject: ELA

question: The unexpected ______ of rain surprised everyone at the outdoor event. Which choice correctly completes the sentence?

answer_options.A: occurence
answer_options.B: occurance
answer_options.C: occurrence
answer_options.D: ocurrence

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because 'occurrence' is the proper spelling of the word meaning an incident or event. The word is spelled with a double 'c' and a double 'r' (occurrence), which follows the spelling pattern of its root word 'occur.'
subject: ELA

question:
The teacher reminded students that it is _______ to bring their textbooks to class.

Which choice correctly completes the sentence with the correct spelling?

answer_options.A: necessary
answer_options.B: neccessary
answer_options.C: necesary
answer_options.D: neccesary

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because 'necessary' is the correct spelling of the word meaning 'required' or 'essential.' The word is spelled with one 'c' followed by two 's's (n-e-c-e-s-s-a-r-y).
subject: ELA

question: Which group of sentences uses the most variety in sentence patterns?

answer_options.A: The sun rose. The birds sang. The flowers bloomed. The day began.
answer_options.B: When the sun rose, the birds sang. As the flowers bloomed, a new day began.
answer_options.C: The sun rose brightly. The birds sang happily. The flowers bloomed beautifully. The day began peacefully.
answer_options.D: I saw the sun rise. I heard the birds sing. I watched the flowers bloom. I observed the day begin.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it uses complex sentences with introductory dependent clauses ("When the sun rose" and "As the flowers bloomed"), which creates variety in sentence structure and makes the writing more interesting for the reader.
subject: ELA

question:
A student wrote the following paragraph:

"The team practiced every day. They worked on their passing. They ran drills for hours. They studied game footage. They prepared for the championship."

All the sentences follow the same subject-verb pattern. Which choice best varies sentence patterns to create reader interest?

answer_options.A: "The team practiced every day, and they worked on their passing. They ran drills for hours, and they studied game footage. They prepared for the championship."
answer_options.B: "Practicing every day, the team worked on their passing. Running drills for hours, they studied game footage. Preparing for the championship, they showed dedication."
answer_options.C: "Every day, the team practiced. They worked on their passing and ran drills for hours. After studying game footage, they felt ready for the championship."
answer_options.D: "The team practiced every day because they wanted to win. They worked on their passing. They ran drills for hours. They studied game footage. They prepared for the championship."

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it effectively varies sentence patterns to create reader interest. The paragraph uses three different sentence structures: the first sentence begins with a fronted adverbial ('Every day'), the second uses a compound predicate with two verbs ('worked' and 'ran'), and the third is a complex sentence starting with an introductory phrase ('After studying game footage'). This variety of sentence types and structures makes the writing more engaging than the original repetitive pattern.
subject: ELA

question:
A student wrote a paragraph with sentences that all begin the same way:

The rain fell softly. The thunder rumbled. The lightning flashed. The storm passed.

Which choice best varies the sentence patterns to create more reader interest?

answer_options.A: The rain fell softly, and the thunder rumbled. The lightning flashed. The storm passed.
answer_options.B: While the rain fell softly, the thunder rumbled. After the lightning flashed, the storm passed.
answer_options.C: The rain fell softly the thunder rumbled. The lightning flashed the storm passed.
answer_options.D: The rain fell softly and the thunder rumbled and the lightning flashed and the storm passed.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it varies the sentence patterns by beginning sentences with dependent clauses ('While the rain fell softly' and 'After the lightning flashed'), which creates variety in sentence structure and maintains reader interest.
subject: ELA

question:
Read this paragraph:

The ancient Egyptians developed sophisticated methods for building pyramids. Engineers carefully planned each structure to ensure stability. Construction required thousands of workers over many years. These massive monuments were totally awesome and super cool to look at.

Which choice revises the final sentence to maintain a consistent formal tone throughout the paragraph?

answer_options.A: These massive monuments were impressive structures that inspired awe.
answer_options.B: These massive monuments were totally rad and amazing.
answer_options.C: These massive monuments were really, really cool to see.
answer_options.D: These massive monuments were kind of amazing, you know?

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it maintains the formal, academic tone established in the rest of the paragraph. Words like 'impressive' and 'inspired awe' are appropriate for an informational text about ancient Egyptian engineering and match the sophisticated, objective style of the preceding sentences.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph below. The underlined sentence has an inconsistent tone.

The laboratory conducted extensive trials to determine the medication's efficacy. <u>The results were totally awesome and surprised all the doctors.</u> Subsequent studies confirmed the initial findings.

Which revision of the underlined sentence maintains a consistent formal tone throughout the paragraph?

answer_options.A: The results were really great and made all the doctors happy.
answer_options.B: The results demonstrated significant promise and intrigued the medical community.
answer_options.C: The results were kind of surprising but in a good way for everyone.
answer_options.D: The results were super impressive to the people who saw them.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it uses formal, academic language ('demonstrated significant promise,' 'intrigued the medical community') that matches the formal tone established in the surrounding sentences ('conducted extensive trials,' 'efficacy,' 'subsequent studies confirmed'). The other options contain informal language such as 'really great,' 'happy,' 'kind of,' 'in a good way,' and 'super impressive,' which clash with the paragraph's formal style.
subject: ELA

question:
The paragraph below has a formal, academic tone. Which choice maintains this consistent tone when added to the end of the paragraph?

The ancient Egyptians developed sophisticated methods for preserving food in their hot climate. They used salt to cure meats and fish, extending their shelf life significantly. Archaeological evidence suggests these techniques were refined over centuries of practice.

answer_options.A: It was pretty cool how they figured all this stuff out without modern technology.
answer_options.B: These preservation methods demonstrate remarkable technological advancement for the period.
answer_options.C: Can you believe they managed to do all this without any refrigerators?
answer_options.D: And they just kept getting better at it, which was totally awesome!

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it maintains the formal, academic tone established in the paragraph. The sentence uses sophisticated vocabulary ('demonstrate,' 'remarkable,' 'technological advancement') and an objective, informative style that matches the rest of the paragraph, ensuring consistency in style and tone throughout the writing.
subject: ELA

question: Read the sentence. Marcus was reluctant to jump into the cold lake, hesitating at the edge and shivering as he looked at the freezing water. Which choice best defines 'reluctant' as used in the sentence?

answer_options.A: eager and excited
answer_options.B: unwilling or hesitant
answer_options.C: angry and upset
answer_options.D: confused and lost

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the context clues 'hesitating at the edge' and 'shivering' show that Marcus was unwilling or hesitant to jump into the cold water, which is the meaning of 'reluctant' in this sentence.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the following paragraph:

The politician's response to the scandal was deliberately ambiguous, allowing her to avoid taking a clear stance. Her vague statements could be interpreted in multiple ways, leaving voters unsure of her true position on the issue.

Which choice best describes the meaning of "ambiguous" as used in the paragraph?

answer_options.A: Clear and direct
answer_options.B: Open to multiple interpretations
answer_options.C: Forcefully argued
answer_options.D: Completely silent

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the paragraph provides several context clues that define "ambiguous." The phrase "avoid taking a clear stance" indicates that ambiguous means the opposite of clear. The key clue "could be interpreted in multiple ways" directly defines ambiguous as something open to different understandings. Additionally, the word "vague" and the result that voters were "unsure of her true position" reinforce that ambiguous describes statements that lack a single, definite meaning.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the sentence below.

"The archaeologist carefully excavated the ancient artifact, using small brushes and tools to remove the dirt without causing any damage to the fragile object."

Which choice best describes the meaning of "excavated" as used in the sentence?

answer_options.A: Buried underground
answer_options.B: Dug out carefully
answer_options.C: Destroyed completely
answer_options.D: Sold to a museum

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the context clues in the sentence—'using small brushes and tools to remove the dirt without causing any damage'—indicate that 'excavated' means to dig out something carefully. The archaeologist is uncovering the artifact from the dirt, not burying, destroying, or selling it.
subject: ELA

question: The Latin root 'aud' means 'to hear.' Which word contains this root and relates to hearing?

answer_options.A: audience
answer_options.B: visible
answer_options.C: portable
answer_options.D: dictation

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because 'audience' contains the Latin root 'aud' (meaning 'to hear') and refers to a group of people who listen to or watch a performance, directly relating to the sense of hearing.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best demonstrates the skill described in L.6.4.B at hard difficulty?

answer_options.A: The correct choice that matches the standard.
answer_options.B: An incorrect distractor.
answer_options.C: Another incorrect distractor.
answer_options.D: Another incorrect distractor.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it matches the skill described in the standard.
subject: ELA

question: The Latin root 'struct' means 'to build,' and the prefix 'de-' means 'down' or 'away.' Based on these word parts, which choice best describes the meaning of 'destruction'?

answer_options.A: The act of building upward
answer_options.B: The process of tearing down
answer_options.C: The skill of designing structures
answer_options.D: The ability to create something

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because 'destruction' combines the prefix 'de-' (meaning 'down' or 'away') with the root 'struct' (meaning 'to build'). Together, these word parts indicate the opposite of building—taking something down or tearing it apart.
subject: ELA

question:
A student finds this dictionary entry for the word "brilliant":

bril•liant /ˈbril-yənt/ adjective
1: very bright and shining
2: extremely intelligent or talented

Which choice correctly identifies the part of speech for "brilliant"?

answer_options.A: noun
answer_options.B: verb
answer_options.C: adjective
answer_options.D: adverb

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because the dictionary entry shows "adjective" after the pronunciation, which identifies the part of speech for "brilliant." Dictionaries provide this information to help readers understand how to use a word correctly in a sentence.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the sentence and the dictionary entry below.

Sentence: The archer picked up his bow and notched an arrow.

Dictionary entry for "bow":
bow¹ /bō/ n. 1. a weapon for shooting arrows, consisting of a curved piece of wood joined by a taut string. 2. a knot with two loops and two loose ends.
bow² /bou/ v. 1. to bend the upper body forward as a sign of respect. 2. to submit or yield. n. 1. an act of bending forward.

Which choice correctly identifies the pronunciation and part of speech of "bow" as used in the sentence?

answer_options.A: /bō/ (rhymes with "go"), noun
answer_options.B: /bou/ (rhymes with "cow"), verb
answer_options.C: /bō/ (rhymes with "go"), verb
answer_options.D: /bou/ (rhymes with "cow"), noun

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because the dictionary entry shows that 'bow¹' meaning 'a weapon for shooting arrows' is pronounced /bō/ (rhymes with 'go') and is listed as a noun (n.). In the sentence, the archer's bow is a weapon for shooting arrows, so it matches this definition, pronunciation, and part of speech.
subject: ELA

question: Maya encounters the word 'amphitheater' in a book about ancient Rome. She wants to find both the correct pronunciation and the part of speech. Which reference material should she consult?

answer_options.A: A thesaurus, which lists synonyms and antonyms
answer_options.B: A dictionary, which provides pronunciation and part of speech
answer_options.C: A glossary, which defines technical terms in a specific subject
answer_options.D: An atlas, which contains maps and geographical information

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because a dictionary provides both the pronunciation (using phonetic symbols or respellings) and the part of speech for each word entry. Maya needs both pieces of information, which a dictionary is specifically designed to supply.
subject: ELA

question: A student reads the sentence 'The musician's performance was mediocre at best.' The student thinks 'mediocre' means 'average or ordinary.' Which choice describes the BEST way to verify this meaning?

answer_options.A: Checking a dictionary to confirm that 'mediocre' means 'average or ordinary'
answer_options.B: Asking a classmate what they think 'mediocre' means
answer_options.C: Looking for familiar word parts in 'mediocre' to guess its meaning
answer_options.D: Relying on prior knowledge of similar words to assume the meaning is correct

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because a dictionary provides an authoritative definition that confirms whether the student's preliminary determination of the word's meaning is accurate. Checking a dictionary is a reliable and direct method for verifying word meanings.
subject: ELA

question: In the sentence 'The facade of the building was beautifully decorated with carved stone figures,' a student thinks 'facade' means 'the front of a building.' Which choice describes the BEST way to verify this meaning?

answer_options.A: Looking up 'facade' in a dictionary to confirm the definition matches the inferred meaning
answer_options.B: Asking a classmate what they think 'facade' means
answer_options.C: Checking if 'facade' has any familiar word parts that might hint at its meaning
answer_options.D: Counting how many times 'facade' appears in the paragraph

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because consulting a dictionary is a reliable and direct method to verify whether an inferred word meaning is accurate. The dictionary provides an authoritative definition that the student can compare to their preliminary determination.
subject: ELA

question: In the sentence 'The meticulous artist spent hours on every tiny detail,' a student thinks 'meticulous' means 'very careful and precise.' Which choice best describes how to verify this meaning?

answer_options.A: Looking up 'meticulous' in a dictionary to confirm the definition
answer_options.B: Asking a classmate what they think 'meticulous' means
answer_options.C: Looking for familiar prefixes or suffixes in 'meticulous' to guess its meaning
answer_options.D: Relying on prior knowledge about artists without confirming the definition

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because looking up 'meticulous' in a dictionary provides an authoritative definition that directly verifies whether the student's inferred meaning ('very careful and precise') is accurate. The dictionary confirms that meticulous means showing great attention to detail and being very careful, which matches the student's preliminary determination.
subject: ELA

question: Read the sentence: "The old house groaned in the fierce wind." Which choice best explains what the personification "the house groaned" means?

answer_options.A: The house was making creaking and straining sounds.
answer_options.B: The house was experiencing human pain and suffering.
answer_options.C: The house was completely silent during the storm.
answer_options.D: The house collapsed to the ground immediately.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because personification gives human qualities to non-human things. When the house "groaned," it means the house was making sounds similar to a groan—creaking and straining sounds caused by the wind—rather than actually feeling pain like a person would.
subject: ELA

question: Read the sentence: "The ancient oak tree stood as a silent guardian, its branches embracing the children who played beneath it." Which choice best explains the effect of the personification in this sentence?

answer_options.A: It suggests that the tree is alive and can make decisions like a human.
answer_options.B: It creates a sense that the tree offers protection and comfort to the children.
answer_options.C: It implies that the tree is dangerous and might harm the children.
answer_options.D: It shows that the tree is very old and about to fall down.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the personification describes the tree as a 'silent guardian' with branches 'embracing' the children, which conveys a sense of protection and comfort—the intended figurative meaning of the author's word choice.
subject: ELA

question: Read the sentence: "The wind whispered through the trees, sharing secrets with the leaves." Which choice best describes what the personification "the wind whispered" suggests about the wind?

answer_options.A: The wind was actually speaking words.
answer_options.B: The wind made a soft, quiet sound.
answer_options.C: The wind was very strong and loud.
answer_options.D: The wind was angry and stormy.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the personification "the wind whispered" gives human-like qualities to the wind to suggest that it made a soft, gentle, and quiet sound as it moved through the trees. Personification is a figure of speech in which non-human things are given human characteristics, and "whispering" is a human action that implies quiet, gentle speech.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best describes the relationship between the words "petal" and "flower"?

answer_options.A: cause/effect
answer_options.B: part/whole
answer_options.C: item/category
answer_options.D: synonyms

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because a petal is a part of a flower, which is a part/whole relationship. The petal is one component that makes up the whole flower, similar to how a page is part of a book or a wheel is part of a car.
subject: ELA

question: The words 'negligence' and 'accident' share a cause/effect relationship because negligence can lead to an accident. Which choice shows a word pair with the same relationship type?

answer_options.A: slice and pie
answer_options.B: dedication and success
answer_options.C: sparrow and bird
answer_options.D: brick and wall

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because 'dedication' and 'success' have a cause/effect relationship. Dedication can cause or lead to success, just as negligence can lead to an accident. This matches the cause/effect relationship described in the question.
subject: ELA

question: The words 'chapter' and 'novel' share a specific relationship. Which choice best describes how these words are related?

answer_options.A: cause/effect
answer_options.B: part/whole
answer_options.C: item/category
answer_options.D: synonyms

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because a chapter is a component or part of a novel, demonstrating a part/whole relationship. A novel is composed of multiple chapters, so 'chapter' represents one section of the larger whole, 'novel.'
subject: ELA

question: The words below all describe someone who is careful about spending money. Which choice has a positive connotation?

answer_options.A: Stingy
answer_options.B: Cheap
answer_options.C: Thrifty
answer_options.D: Miserly

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because 'thrifty' has a positive connotation, suggesting wise and careful management of money. The other options—'stingy,' 'cheap,' and 'miserly'—all have negative connotations, suggesting an excessive or unpleasant reluctance to spend money.
subject: ELA

question: A restaurant critic wrote that the new bistro's prices were reasonable, calling the chef's approach to ingredients _____. The chef was pleased to read this compliment. Which choice best completes the sentence to convey a positive connotation?

answer_options.A: stingy
answer_options.B: cheap
answer_options.C: thrifty
answer_options.D: miserly

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because "thrifty" has a positive connotation, suggesting wise and careful use of resources without being wasteful. The context requires a word with a positive connotation since the chef was pleased with the compliment, and "thrifty" appropriately conveys this positive meaning about prudent resource management.
subject: ELA

question: The words 'cheap,' 'frugal,' 'thrifty,' and 'stingy' all have similar denotations related to being careful with money. Which choice identifies the word with the most positive connotation?

answer_options.A: cheap
answer_options.B: frugal
answer_options.C: thrifty
answer_options.D: stingy

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because 'thrifty' has a positive connotation suggesting someone is wisely economical and resourceful with money. Among words with similar denotations about being careful with money, 'thrifty' carries the most favorable association, implying prudence and good management.
subject: ELA

question: Marcus wants to test whether plants grow taller with more sunlight. He writes a statement predicting that plants receiving more sunlight will grow taller than plants in shade. Which term describes Marcus's prediction?

answer_options.A: hypothesis
answer_options.B: conclusion
answer_options.C: evidence
answer_options.D: variable

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because a hypothesis is a testable prediction made before conducting an experiment. Marcus is making a prediction about the outcome of his plant growth experiment, which is the definition of a hypothesis.
subject: ELA

question: Marcus is designing an experiment to test whether plants grow taller with more sunlight. Before beginning, he writes down his prediction: "If plants receive more sunlight, then they will grow taller because sunlight is needed for photosynthesis." Which term best describes Marcus's prediction?

answer_options.A: conclusion
answer_options.B: hypothesis
answer_options.C: inference
answer_options.D: variable

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because a hypothesis is a testable prediction made before conducting an experiment, based on prior knowledge and observation. Marcus's statement predicts the outcome of his experiment before he conducts it, which is the defining characteristic of a hypothesis in scientific inquiry.
subject: ELA

question: Marcus is designing an experiment to test how different amounts of water affect plant growth. He writes, 'If I give a plant more water, then it will grow taller than a plant that receives less water.' In scientific investigation, this type of prediction is called which term?

answer_options.A: conclusion
answer_options.B: hypothesis
answer_options.C: evidence
answer_options.D: variable

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because a hypothesis is a testable prediction that states what the researcher expects to happen in an experiment. Marcus's statement predicts a specific outcome ('the plant will grow taller') based on a condition ('more water'), which is the defining characteristic of a hypothesis in scientific investigation.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage:

The Arctic fox is remarkably adapted to life in the frozen tundra. Its thick, white fur provides excellent insulation against temperatures that can drop to minus 50 degrees Fahrenheit. The fox's small, rounded ears reduce heat loss, and its furry paw pads allow it to walk on ice without slipping. During summer months, the Arctic fox's fur changes to brown or gray, helping it blend in with rocks and plants when there is no snow.

Which detail from the passage best supports the inference that the Arctic fox has physical features that provide insulation against extreme cold?

answer_options.A: Its thick, white fur provides excellent insulation against temperatures that can drop to minus 50 degrees Fahrenheit.
answer_options.B: During summer months, the Arctic fox's fur changes to brown or gray.
answer_options.C: The fox's small, rounded ears reduce heat loss.
answer_options.D: Its furry paw pads allow it to walk on ice without slipping.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it provides specific textual evidence that directly supports the inference about insulation against extreme cold. The detail explicitly states that the fox's thick, white fur provides 'excellent insulation' against temperatures as low as minus 50 degrees Fahrenheit.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage:

The Arctic tern is a small seabird that holds the record for the longest migration of any animal on Earth. Each year, these remarkable birds travel from their breeding grounds in the Arctic to their wintering grounds in the Antarctic and back again—a round trip of approximately 44,000 miles. Scientists have tracked individual terns using lightweight GPS tags, discovering that some birds travel even farther by following winding routes that take advantage of wind patterns. Despite weighing only about four ounces, Arctic terns navigate across vast oceans, endure extreme weather conditions, and face predators such as falcons and skuas. Remarkably, they return to nearly the same nesting site year after year, often within a few feet of their previous nests. Because they spend most of the year in flight and live in regions with extended daylight during breeding and wintering seasons, Arctic terns experience more daylight than any other creature on the planet.

The passage suggests that Arctic terns possess exceptional navigational abilities. Which quotation from the text best supports this inference?

answer_options.A: "Each year, these remarkable birds travel from their breeding grounds in the Arctic to their wintering grounds in the Antarctic and back again"
answer_options.B: "Despite weighing only about four ounces, Arctic terns navigate across vast oceans, endure extreme weather conditions, and face predators"
answer_options.C: "they return to nearly the same nesting site year after year, often within a few feet of their previous nests"
answer_options.D: "Scientists have tracked individual terns using lightweight GPS tags, discovering that some birds travel even farther by following winding routes"

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because returning to nearly the exact same nesting site—within a few feet—after traveling approximately 44,000 miles provides the strongest evidence of exceptional navigational abilities. This precision demonstrates that Arctic terns can navigate with remarkable accuracy across vast distances, directly supporting the inference about their navigational skills.
subject: ELA

question:
Emperor penguins survive in one of the harshest environments on Earth. During the Antarctic winter, temperatures can drop to -60 degrees Fahrenheit. To stay warm, penguins huddle together in large groups, constantly rotating so that each bird takes a turn in the warmer center. Scientists have observed that penguins on the outer edge of the huddle face the coldest winds, while those in the center stay significantly warmer. Despite these challenges, emperor penguins continue to breed during the winter months, protecting their eggs through months of darkness and bitter cold.

Based on the passage, emperor penguins cooperate to survive extreme conditions. Which detail from the passage best supports this inference?

answer_options.A: During the Antarctic winter, temperatures can drop to -60 degrees Fahrenheit.
answer_options.B: To stay warm, penguins huddle together in large groups, constantly rotating so that each bird takes a turn in the warmer center.
answer_options.C: Scientists have observed that penguins on the outer edge of the huddle face the coldest winds, while those in the center stay significantly warmer.
answer_options.D: Despite these challenges, emperor penguins continue to breed during the winter months, protecting their eggs through months of darkness and bitter cold.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it directly describes the cooperative behavior of emperor penguins—huddling together and rotating positions so that each penguin gets a turn in the warmer center. This detail explicitly shows penguins working together to survive the harsh conditions, which supports the inference that they cooperate to survive.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best explains why a memoir is considered literary nonfiction?

answer_options.A: It includes only facts and statistics
answer_options.B: It tells a true story using narrative techniques
answer_options.C: It contains made-up characters and events
answer_options.D: It is written in a formal, academic style

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because literary nonfiction, such as memoirs, combines factual, true content with literary techniques like narrative structure, character development, dialogue, and vivid descriptions. This blend of factual accuracy with storytelling elements defines the genre and distinguishes it from purely informational texts or fiction.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the following excerpt:

"The summer of 1963 was the hottest I could remember. My mother pressed a cool glass of lemonade into my hands as we boarded the bus to Washington, D.C. 'This is history in the making,' she whispered, her voice trembling with something between fear and hope. I was only twelve, but I understood that the crowds gathering before the Lincoln Memorial were witnessing something extraordinary. When Dr. King began to speak, the words seemed to hang in the humid air like a promise."

Which choice provides the BEST evidence that this passage is literary nonfiction?

answer_options.A: The passage uses first-person narration and sensory details to tell a true story from the author's perspective.
answer_options.B: The passage presents factual information about the 1963 March on Washington in chronological order.
answer_options.C: The passage includes dialogue to argue in favor of the Civil Rights Movement.
answer_options.D: The passage provides an objective summary of historical events without personal commentary.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because literary nonfiction is distinguished by its use of narrative techniques—including first-person point of view, sensory details, and personal perspective—to present factual content. The excerpt uses 'I' narration and sensory language such as 'hot,' 'cool glass,' and 'humid air' to tell a true story from the author's viewpoint, which is characteristic of literary nonfiction rather than informational nonfiction.
subject: ELA

question: A memoir titled 'Walking Home' tells the true story of a family's journey across a mountain range. The author uses vivid sensory descriptions, includes actual dialogue, and builds suspense as the family faces dangerous weather. Which choice best identifies the feature that classifies this text as literary nonfiction?

answer_options.A: The text presents only facts and statistics about mountains.
answer_options.B: The text describes fictional characters in an imagined setting.
answer_options.C: The text presents true events using narrative techniques like sensory details and suspense.
answer_options.D: The text is organized as a series of numbered instructions.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because literary nonfiction is characterized by the combination of factual, true content with narrative techniques typically associated with fiction, such as vivid sensory descriptions, dialogue, and suspense. This distinguishes it from purely informational texts, fiction, and other genres.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the following passage:

Honeybees play a crucial role in our ecosystem. As they fly from flower to flower collecting nectar, they transfer pollen between plants. This process, called pollination, helps many fruits, vegetables, and nuts grow. In fact, bees are responsible for pollinating about one-third of the food we eat. Without honeybees, many of our favorite foods would become scarce and expensive.

Which choice best states the central idea of the passage?

answer_options.A: Honeybees collect nectar from many different flowers.
answer_options.B: Honeybees are important because they help pollinate much of our food supply.
answer_options.C: Without bees, food would become more expensive.
answer_options.D: Bees fly from flower to flower during the day.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it captures the main point of the passage: honeybees are essential to our food supply through their role in pollination. The passage explains how bees transfer pollen and pollinate about one-third of our food, making this the central idea that connects all the supporting details.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the following passage:

Dr. Jane Goodall's groundbreaking research transformed our understanding of chimpanzees and challenged long-held scientific beliefs. When she began her work in Tanzania in 1960, scientists believed humans were the only species capable of making and using tools. Goodall observed chimpanzees stripping leaves from twigs to create tools for extracting termites from mounds. This discovery forced the scientific community to reconsider what separates humans from other animals. Goodall's patient, long-term observation methods also established new standards for primate research. Rather than studying animals in captivity, she spent years living among chimpanzees, documenting their complex social relationships, emotional bonds, and unique personalities. Her work demonstrated that chimpanzees experience emotions once thought exclusive to humans, including grief, joy, and compassion.

Which choice best states the central idea of the passage and explains how the detail about chimpanzees making tools supports it?

answer_options.A: The central idea is that Goodall's research transformed scientific understanding of chimpanzees; the tool-making detail supports this by showing how her observations disproved a long-held scientific belief.
answer_options.B: The central idea is that chimpanzees are intelligent animals; the tool-making detail supports this by describing how they use sticks to find food.
answer_options.C: The central idea is that scientists should study animals in the wild; the tool-making detail supports this by showing that captive studies miss important behaviors.
answer_options.D: The central idea is that Goodall lived among chimpanzees for many years; the tool-making detail supports this by explaining her research methods.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it accurately identifies the central idea—that Goodall's research transformed scientific understanding—and explains how the tool-making detail supports this central idea by showing that her observations disproved the long-held belief that only humans could make tools. The passage emphasizes how Goodall's discoveries 'forced the scientific community to reconsider what separates humans from other animals,' which directly connects the tool-making observation to the transformation of scientific understanding.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage below and answer the question.

Honeybees play a crucial role in food production around the world. As bees travel from flower to flower collecting nectar, they transfer pollen between plants. This process, called pollination, helps many crops grow and produce food. In fact, scientists estimate that bees help produce about one-third of the food people eat. Without bees, many fruits, vegetables, and nuts would be much harder to grow. However, bee populations have been declining in recent years due to pesticides, habitat loss, and disease. Farmers and scientists are working together to protect these important insects, recognizing that bees are essential partners in agriculture.

Which choice best states a central idea of the passage?

answer_options.A: Bees face many threats, including pesticides and habitat loss.
answer_options.B: Honeybees are vital to agriculture because they pollinate crops that produce food.
answer_options.C: Farmers and scientists are collaborating to protect bee populations.
answer_options.D: Scientists have discovered that bees help produce one-third of the world's food.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it captures the main focus of the passage: the essential role honeybees play in food production through pollination. The passage emphasizes this idea throughout, explaining how pollination works, noting that bees help produce about one-third of the food people eat, and describing bees as 'essential partners in agriculture.'
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage:

Dr. Jane Goodall is one of the world's most famous scientists. When she was a young girl, she received a stuffed chimpanzee toy as a gift. This toy sparked her lifelong fascination with animals. Years later, while studying chimpanzees in Africa, she made a remarkable discovery: she observed a chimpanzee using a stick to dig for termites. This was the first time anyone had seen an animal use a tool. Another time, she watched a chimpanzee named David Greybeard gently groom another chimp, showing that these animals form close bonds.

Which choice describes how the author elaborates on Dr. Goodall's discoveries?

answer_options.A: By listing the exact dates of each discovery
answer_options.B: By sharing specific examples of what she observed
answer_options.C: By comparing her to other famous scientists
answer_options.D: By defining scientific vocabulary words

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the author elaborates on Dr. Goodall's discoveries by providing specific examples of her observations, such as the chimpanzee using a stick to dig for termites and David Greybeard grooming another chimp. These concrete examples help readers understand the nature and importance of her work.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage and answer the question.

Dr. Sylvia Earle and the Ocean's Guardians

Dr. Sylvia Earle first emerged as a voice for the oceans in 1970, when she led an all-female team of aquanauts in a two-week underwater mission. At the time, few scientists had spent such extended periods studying marine life in its natural habitat. This groundbreaking expedition introduced Earle as a pioneer willing to challenge conventions.

Throughout her career, Earle has illustrated the urgency of ocean conservation through vivid accounts of what she has witnessed. In one striking anecdote, she describes returning to a reef she had studied decades earlier: where once there had been a thriving ecosystem of coral and fish, she found only bleached skeletons and silence. She recounts swimming through areas once teeming with sharks, now empty because of overfishing. These personal stories make the abstract concept of environmental decline impossible to ignore.

Earle elaborates on her message by pointing to specific successes that offer hope. She highlights the creation of marine protected areas around the world, noting that when key regions are shielded from fishing and drilling, ecosystems can recover. She cites the revival of fish populations in certain protected zones as evidence that human intervention can reverse damage, not just cause it. By grounding her arguments in concrete examples, Earle transforms despair into a call to action.

Which choice best explains how the author develops Dr. Earle as a key individual to support the passage's central message about ocean conservation?

answer_options.A: By presenting Earle as a distant expert, the author emphasizes that conservation requires specialized knowledge unavailable to ordinary people.
answer_options.B: By tracing Earle's journey from pioneering scientist to witness of environmental decline to advocate for solutions, the author demonstrates that sustained personal commitment can transform awareness into action.
answer_options.C: By focusing primarily on Earle's all-female team, the author suggests that gender diversity is the most important factor in successful conservation efforts.
answer_options.D: By contrasting Earle's early optimism with her later despair, the author warns that environmental degradation is ultimately unstoppable.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it accurately analyzes how the author develops Dr. Earle as a key individual throughout the passage. The author introduces Earle as a pioneering scientist in paragraph 1, illustrates her role through personal anecdotes of witnessing environmental decline in paragraph 2, and elaborates by showing her advocacy for concrete solutions in paragraph 3. This progression supports the central message that individual commitment can lead to meaningful conservation action.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage:

Dr. Maya Chen's work in marine conservation began with a simple observation: coral reefs near protected waters were healthier than those in unprotected areas. This discovery led her to study why.

Her research revealed striking results. For example, a small marine sanctuary in Australia helped restore damaged coral within five years. Local fishermen also reported seeing more fish species return to the area. One fisherman, Tomas Grey, said, 'The waters are alive again—we catch more fish now than we did twenty years ago.'

Dr. Chen expanded her work globally, publishing over thirty papers and helping establish new marine protected areas. Today, her methods are used by conservationists worldwide.

Which choice best describes how the author elaborates on Dr. Chen's research findings?

answer_options.A: By describing Dr. Chen's childhood near the ocean
answer_options.B: By providing specific examples, such as the Australian sanctuary and a fisherman's account
answer_options.C: By comparing Dr. Chen to other marine biologists
answer_options.D: By listing all the countries where she conducted research

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the author elaborates on Dr. Chen's findings by providing specific examples that support and expand upon her research. The passage includes the example of an Australian marine sanctuary that restored coral within five years, as well as a fisherman's firsthand account (an anecdote) describing the return of fish species. These concrete examples and anecdotes illustrate and develop her initial findings about protected marine areas.
subject: ELA

question: Read the sentence: "The new recycling program took root in our community, and within months, more people were separating their trash than ever before." Which choice best describes what "took root" means in this sentence?

answer_options.A: grew like a plant in the ground
answer_options.B: became established and accepted
answer_options.C: was planted in the soil
answer_options.D: started to disappear slowly

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because "took root" is figurative language meaning to become established or accepted. In this sentence, the recycling program became successfully established in the community, just as a plant becomes established when its roots grow into the soil.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the following passage:

The scientist stood at the edge of the excavation site, her boots caked with red clay. For months, she had been chasing shadows. Each hypothesis that initially seemed promising eventually crumbled under scrutiny. Each failed experiment was a dead end, each inconclusive result a step backward. But today, something caught her eye: a fragment of bone protruding from the sediment. It was small, almost insignificant, but it represented the first concrete evidence in her search. She knew that in science, one discovery often unlocks many doors. This tiny fragment might be the key that opened them all.

Which choice best describes the meaning of "chasing shadows" as used in the passage?

answer_options.A: Pursuing ideas that prove to be insubstantial or unrealized
answer_options.B: Working in dark conditions with limited visibility
answer_options.C: Studying the movement of light and reflection
answer_options.D: Following the guidance of other researchers

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because 'chasing shadows' is used figuratively in this passage to describe the scientist's pursuit of hypotheses that seemed promising but ultimately failed. The context—'each hypothesis that initially seemed promising eventually crumbled under scrutiny'—reveals that the scientist was pursuing ideas that turned out to be insubstantial, like shadows that cannot be caught.
subject: ELA

question: Read the passage: "The team's championship victory opened doors for many young athletes in the community. Suddenly, sports programs received more funding, and coaches became more accessible to neighborhood kids who had never played organized sports before." Which choice best describes what the phrase "opened doors" means as used in the passage?

answer_options.A: Physically unlocked entryways to buildings
answer_options.B: Created new opportunities and possibilities
answer_options.C: Allowed public access to private facilities
answer_options.D: Removed security measures from buildings

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because 'opened doors' is a figurative expression meaning to create new opportunities or possibilities. In the passage, the team's victory led to increased funding for sports programs and greater access to coaches for young athletes, which demonstrates new opportunities becoming available to the community.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the following passage about bees:

(1) Bees are essential pollinators that help plants grow and produce food. Without bees, many of the fruits and vegetables we eat would not exist.

(2) Sadly, bee populations are declining rapidly. Scientists have found that pesticides, habitat loss, and climate change are the main causes of this decline.

(3) Fortunately, there are ways to help bees. Planting flowers, reducing pesticide use, and creating bee habitats can all make a difference.

(4) If we take action now, we can protect bees and ensure our food supply for the future.

Which choice best describes how paragraph 3 contributes to the development of ideas in the passage?

answer_options.A: It introduces the main topic of bees and their importance.
answer_options.B: It explains the problems facing bee populations.
answer_options.C: It presents solutions to the problem described earlier.
answer_options.D: It summarizes all the main points of the passage.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because paragraph 3 presents solutions to the problem of declining bee populations that was introduced in paragraph 2. The paragraph begins with 'Fortunately, there are ways to help bees' and lists specific actions people can take, which fits the problem-solution structure of the passage and advances the development of ideas from problem to solution.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the following passage about coral reefs.

[1] Coral reefs are often called the rainforests of the sea, teeming with life and color. These underwater ecosystems support approximately 25% of all marine species, despite covering less than 1% of the ocean floor. For coastal communities around the world, reefs provide food, income from tourism, and protection from storms.

[2] However, rising ocean temperatures are causing widespread coral bleaching. When water becomes too warm, corals expel the algae living in their tissues, turning white and leaving them vulnerable to disease. Scientists have documented mass bleaching events that have destroyed thousands of miles of reef in recent decades.

[3] The loss of coral reefs would have devastating consequences beyond the marine environment. Coastal fisheries would collapse, threatening the food security of millions of people. Tourism industries would suffer, eliminating jobs in island nations that depend on reef-related activities. Additionally, shorelines would become more vulnerable to erosion and storm damage.

[4] Fortunately, researchers are developing innovative solutions to protect remaining reefs. Some teams are breeding heat-resistant coral varieties in laboratories, while others are installing artificial structures that can serve as reef foundations. Marine protected areas are being expanded to reduce additional stressors like pollution and overfishing.

[5] The future of coral reefs depends on both local conservation efforts and global action on climate change. While restoration projects offer hope, they cannot succeed without addressing the root cause of rising temperatures. Protecting these ecosystems requires coordinated action at every level, from individual choices to international policies.

Which choice best describes how paragraph 3 fits into the overall structure of the passage and contributes to the development of the ideas?

answer_options.A: It introduces the central problem that the rest of the passage addresses.
answer_options.B: It expands on the consequences of the problem, demonstrating why the issue matters beyond marine life.
answer_options.C: It presents the primary solution that the author recommends for protecting coral reefs.
answer_options.D: It provides scientific evidence to prove that coral bleaching is occurring worldwide.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because paragraph 3 explains the broader consequences of coral reef loss, including impacts on fisheries, tourism, and coastal protection. By expanding the discussion from marine life to human communities, this paragraph demonstrates the significance of the problem and creates urgency for the solutions presented later. Structurally, paragraph 3 serves as a bridge between the problem description in paragraph 2 and the solutions in paragraph 4, showing readers why the problem demands attention before introducing potential remedies.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage below.

**Saving Sea Turtles**

(1) Sea turtles have swum in Earth's oceans for millions of years. (2) Today, these ancient creatures face serious threats. (3) Pollution, fishing nets, and habitat destruction have caused sea turtle populations to drop dramatically. (4) Some species are now endangered. (5) Fortunately, people are working to protect sea turtles. (6) Conservation groups patrol beaches where turtles lay their eggs, protecting nests from predators. (7) Laws now restrict fishing practices that harm turtles. (8) These efforts are making a difference, giving hope that sea turtles will survive for generations to come.

Which choice best describes how sentence 5 contributes to the overall structure of the passage?

answer_options.A: It introduces the main problem that the passage describes.
answer_options.B: It provides specific examples of how people are helping turtles.
answer_options.C: It signals a shift from describing threats to explaining solutions.
answer_options.D: It concludes the passage by summarizing the main ideas.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because sentence 5 marks the transition point in the passage's problem-solution structure. The first part of the passage describes the threats facing sea turtles, while sentence 5 introduces the shift to discussing solutions. The word 'Fortunately' signals this change, and the following sentences describe specific protection efforts and their positive results.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the following text:

Recycling is one of the easiest ways we can help protect our planet. Every day, millions of plastic bottles are thrown away and end up in landfills or oceans. By simply placing these bottles in recycling bins instead of trash cans, we can make a huge difference. Recycling reduces waste, saves energy, and helps keep our environment clean for future generations. Everyone should make recycling a daily habit—it's a small action that has a big impact.

Which choice best describes the author's purpose in writing this text?

answer_options.A: To entertain readers with a funny story about recycling
answer_options.B: To persuade readers to make recycling a habit
answer_options.C: To inform readers about the history of recycling
answer_options.D: To explain how plastic bottles are manufactured

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the author's purpose is to persuade readers to make recycling a daily habit. The text conveys this purpose through persuasive language such as 'everyone should make recycling a daily habit' and by emphasizing the positive environmental impact of recycling to motivate readers to take action.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the following passage:

The Digital Divide in American Schools

Walk into a school in an affluent suburb, and you'll likely see students working on individual tablets, accessing online resources, and collaborating through educational apps. Visit a school in an under-resourced neighborhood just a few miles away, and you might find students sharing outdated textbooks, struggling to complete assignments that require internet access they don't have at home. This disparity isn't just about technology—it's about opportunity. Students without digital access fall behind in research skills, miss out on interactive learning experiences, and enter the job market already at a disadvantage. Some argue that technology companies should step up and donate devices. Others suggest that schools reallocate their budgets. But these solutions ignore the root cause: unequal funding systems that leave some communities perpetually under-resourced. Until we address the fundamental unfairness in how we fund public education, the digital divide will continue to separate those who have from those who don't.

Which choice best identifies the author's point of view and explains how it is conveyed in the passage?

answer_options.A: The author believes technology companies should donate devices to under-resourced schools, conveyed through the description of students lacking digital access.
answer_options.B: The author argues that the digital divide stems from unequal funding systems, conveyed through the dismissal of technology donations and budget reallocations as solutions that 'ignore the root cause.'
answer_options.C: The author opposes the use of technology in schools, conveyed through the comparison of schools with and without digital resources.
answer_options.D: The author wants schools to share resources more equally, conveyed through the description of students in under-resourced neighborhoods.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the author argues that the digital divide stems from unequal funding systems by contrasting surface-level solutions with what the author identifies as 'the root cause.' The phrase 'ignore the root cause' and the concluding statement about 'fundamental unfairness in how we fund public education' directly convey this point of view, showing that the author sees funding inequality as the central issue rather than a lack of devices or poor budget management.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the following passage:

"School uniforms have been a topic of debate for many years. However, the evidence strongly supports their implementation in public schools. Studies show that schools with uniform policies report 30% fewer discipline problems and improved attendance rates. Students spend less time worrying about what to wear and more time focusing on their studies. Additionally, uniforms create a sense of belonging and school pride. When everyone dresses alike, students are judged by their character and achievements rather than their clothing brands or style. The benefits are clear: school uniforms lead to better learning environments and more successful students."

Which choice best describes the author's point of view and how it is conveyed in the passage?

answer_options.A: The author opposes school uniforms and conveys this by describing the financial burden on families.
answer_options.B: The author supports school uniforms and conveys this by presenting statistics and positive outcomes.
answer_options.C: The author remains neutral about school uniforms and conveys this by presenting equal arguments on both sides.
answer_options.D: The author questions the effectiveness of school uniforms and conveys this by mentioning discipline problems in schools.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the author clearly advocates for school uniforms throughout the passage, using phrases like 'the evidence strongly supports' and 'the benefits are clear.' The author conveys this supportive point of view by citing specific statistics ('30% fewer discipline problems') and listing positive outcomes such as improved attendance, better focus, and increased school pride.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage and the table below.

Passage: Sea turtles face many dangers in the ocean. Conservation groups work hard to protect these ancient creatures. One important effort involves protecting turtle nesting beaches. When beaches are protected, more baby turtles can safely reach the ocean. Scientists track turtle populations to see if these efforts are working.

Table: Sea Turtle Nesting Numbers at Protected Beaches
Year | Number of Nests
2018 | 150
2019 | 180
2020 | 220
2021 | 260
2022 | 310

The passage explains that conservation groups protect nesting beaches to help sea turtles. Based on the table, which statement best describes what happened to the number of sea turtle nests at protected beaches from 2018 to 2022?

answer_options.A: The number of nests decreased each year.
answer_options.B: The number of nests stayed about the same.
answer_options.C: The number of nests increased each year.
answer_options.D: The number of nests went up and down.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because the table shows that the number of sea turtle nests increased each year from 150 nests in 2018 to 310 nests in 2022. Integrating the passage and the table shows that protecting nesting beaches appears to be helping sea turtles, as the increasing nest numbers suggest conservation efforts are having a positive effect.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage and study the table. Then answer the question.

Passage:
Renewable energy sources, such as solar and wind power, have become increasingly important in the fight against climate change. Unlike fossil fuels, renewable sources produce little to no greenhouse gas emissions during operation. In recent years, advances in technology have made solar panels and wind turbines more efficient and less expensive to produce. Government incentives in many countries have also encouraged businesses and homeowners to install renewable energy systems. Experts predict that renewable energy will continue to grow as countries work to meet international climate goals.

Table: U.S. Renewable Energy Production (Billion Kilowatt-hours)
         Solar   Wind    Total Renewable
2010       1      95          176
2015      27     191          298
2020      91     338          792

Which conclusion about renewable energy is best supported by combining information from BOTH the passage and the table?

answer_options.A: Solar energy production has always been higher than wind energy production.
answer_options.B: Government incentives are the only reason renewable energy has increased.
answer_options.C: Renewable energy production has grown significantly due to technological advances and policy support.
answer_options.D: Wind energy production decreased between 2010 and 2020.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it integrates information from both sources: the passage explains that technological advances and government incentives have contributed to renewable energy growth, while the table shows that total renewable energy production increased from 176 billion kilowatt-hours in 2010 to 792 billion kilowatt-hours in 2020, demonstrating significant growth.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage about climate change. Then study the graph below.

**Passage:**
Climate scientists have documented significant changes in Earth's atmosphere over the past century. Rising global temperatures have led to melting ice caps, rising sea levels, and more extreme weather events. While temperatures have increased throughout the 20th century, the rate of warming has accelerated dramatically in recent decades. This acceleration coincides with increased industrial activity and higher concentrations of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.

Which statement is best supported by combining information from BOTH the passage and the graph?

answer_options.A: Global temperatures have remained stable since 1900.
answer_options.B: The rate of temperature increase has been constant throughout the entire 20th century.
answer_options.C: Temperature increases have accelerated since the 1980s, coinciding with increased industrial activity.
answer_options.D: Ice caps have stopped melting in recent decades due to stable temperatures.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because the passage states that 'the rate of warming has accelerated dramatically in recent decades' and that 'this acceleration coincides with increased industrial activity,' while the graph shows a steeper rise in global temperatures from approximately 1980 to 2020 compared to the more gradual increase from 1900 to 1980. Integrating both sources confirms that temperature increases have accelerated since the 1980s alongside increased industrial activity.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage:

Schools should give students more recess time. First, studies show that physical activity helps children focus better in class. Second, recess allows students to socialize, which helps them develop important social skills. Third, students who have more recess will perform better on standardized tests.

Which claim in the passage is NOT supported by reasons or evidence?

answer_options.A: Physical activity helps children focus better in class.
answer_options.B: Recess allows students to socialize.
answer_options.C: Students who have more recess will perform better on standardized tests.
answer_options.D: Socializing helps students develop important social skills.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because the claim that students who have more recess will perform better on standardized tests appears in the passage without any accompanying reasons or evidence to support it.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the passage below.

Schools should start later in the morning for several important reasons. First, research from the American Academy of Pediatrics confirms that teenagers' biological clocks make them naturally stay up later and need to sleep later in the morning, meaning early start times conflict with their natural sleep patterns. Second, later start times improve student attendance. A 2014 study of high schools across eight districts found that when schools moved start times to 8:30 AM or later, average daily attendance increased by 12% within the first year. Third, later start times reduce traffic accidents involving teenage drivers. Researchers comparing crash rates in two similar counties found a 13% decrease in the county that had delayed its school start time by one hour. Fourth, later start times improve academic performance.
